Analysis¶

This is an entrypoint for the automatic analysis of images using pyaeshtetics.

@author: Giulio Gabrieli

analysis.analyzeImage(pathToImg, method='fast', resize=True, newSize=(600, 400), minStd=10, minSize=20)¶

This functions act as entrypoint for the automatic analysis of an image aesthetic features.

Parameters:

  • pathToImg (str) – path to the image to analyze

  • method – set to analysis to use. Valid methods are ‘fast’,’complete’. Default is ‘fast’.

  • resize (boolean) – indicate wether to resize the image (reduce computational workload, increase requested time)

  • newSize (tuple) – if the image has to be resized, this tuple indicates the new size of the image

  • minStd (int) – minimum standard deviation for the Quadratic Tree Decomposition

  • minSize (int) – minimum size for the Quadratic Tree Decomposition

Returns:

number of character in the text

Return type:

dict

analysis.textDetection(img)¶

This function uses pytesseract to get information about the presence of text in an image.

Parameters:

img (numpy.ndarray) – image to analyze, in RGB

Returns:

number of character in the text

Return type:

int
